Cell.Data: Ha! Told you Heimlock would send us!
Yeahâ¦\nIâm not betting with you again.
I want those ledges clean! One each, letâs go!
Look, a Republican pup is trying to flank us. How cute.
Get them down! Get them all down!
What the hell is going on?!
MaÃ«lys is stuck on an upper ledge but we have to move forward!
Weâll lose a lot of men if the cliff collapses!
Right now, Iâm more worried about these bloody souls being puked out of the earth!
Right. Letâs keep it together! We move as one and do what we do best!
We canât handle it. We need to get back to the Purifiers, now!
Hey soldier, you alright? Whereâs the rest of your squad? Soldier?
Heâs in shock. Leave him be.
Darling, youâre going to owe me big time!
I praise your resilience, mortal. You will make a fine host.
Now come to me! Come to me and be reborn in service of the Sleeper!
I do not request. I command.
You are no human, but you will bow all the same!
What the hell is happening to you?
What happened back there? I feelâ¦ different. How is it that I can use witchcraft now? None of this makes sense.
Svriir? They must have pulled me out of the waterâ¦ But what of Val? Did she drown? Valeria? Val!
If anyone from the Republic saw me transformâ¦
Frankly, I donât know. We should regroup with Operation Dawnbane, shouldnât we?
In your state? Flinging magic and turning into a monstrosity? No no no no no, theyâll burn you alive.
Perhaps. But MaÃ«lys sure as hell will, and with a smile on her face. Look, letâs get out of here first, then weâll figure something out.
We should not be too far from the City-State of Stormfall, that should at least be a safe place!
A winged Svriir? They do come in every shape, donât they?
No matter, they die all the same.
These people are getting torn apartâ¦ I donât get it, Svriir arenât normally this bold, not without good reason.
That soul demon first, now this. Thereâs something wrong around here. Something very wrong.
Witchcraft is forbidden in Stormfall. Anyone caught joining nefarious cults will hang.
We must pull back, weâre too exposed!
If we do, the civilians will get slaughtered!
I know that face. Youâve got a plan. {Alright, letâs hear it.|Alright, letâs hear it.}
You need answers, and I donât think MaÃ«lys will get you anything more than a rope around your neck.

So hereâs my plan. You wait for me in Stormfall, easy enough yes? Meanwhile, I meet up with our forces and try to talk with Edric about the situation, to see how we can convince our people that youâre not a bloody demon.
{Agreed, I would rather appreciate not being executed. Where do we meet?|Agreed, I would rather appreciate not being executed. So, where do we meet?}
On the way here, I heard talk of an inn in Stormfall. The Laughing Sea Gal. Iâll meet you there. Keep a low profile until then.
Why donât you let people in?
For the hundredth time, the city is already filled to capacity with refugees. Weâre not letting anyone in.
Look, I really need to have access. Let me through.
Thatâs not how things work, friend. Only conscripts are allowed through. Order of the Merchant-Prince Damaskus himself.
So you want fighters? I will fight. Now stand aside.
Heh, you are serious my friend? Well, alright then. Go through to the farmlands on the other side of the city! Anyone else want to fight for Stormfall? No? Thatâs what I thought!
Ah! New blood! Get to Mohabiâs shop, he will have you geared up! Courtesy of Stormfall!
I donât want to die! Iâm not a hero, you hear?
Itâs either that or we throw you back outside the walls!
No, please! Donât send me back there! Itâs a bloody slaughter! You havenât seen it! You donât know!
Die a hero, or die a coward. Make up your mind. We need warriors against the Svriir, not whiners.
But the deads! The deads rose back with the earthquake! Weâve all seen it! The Svriir arenât the problem! Why wonât you believe us?!
You are so shameless in your lies. Disgusting.
Conscript! Report to Thunderblade FaÃ¤rad at the battlefront!
I hear say that thereâs nothing random about the Svriir uprising targeting our farms and food supplies!
Of course not! The Republic is behind it, I am sure!
That is preposterous! Why would the Republic organize this? You have no proof whatsoever â
Thatâs the beauty of it! Once on our knees it will be easy for them to force a protectorate on us. And they might even be celebrated for it! This is all a conspiracy, Iâm telling you!

Want to know my theory? The Merchant-Prince is in a sort of mad cult and this is all part of some scheme of theirs! This is all intentional. Maybeâ¦ maybe he is a Svriir himself with some sort of uhâ¦ magic? Ah! That would be a sight!
Justâ¦ just stop right there. That nonsense makes my ears bleed.
Mmmh, I will have to fight for Stormfall if I am to stay within the city walls.
Pay attention! You are all that stands between the greens and your families so stop sobbing and get ready for hacking! Make every blow count!
B-b-but weâre not even trained! How are we supposed to kill them?
Another new conscript, eh? You look different from the others. Oh I know, youâre not wetting your pants. How come?
A soldier, huh? My lucky day. I need someone for a mission, think you got what it takes?
The Svriir have penetrated two of the three defences we built to stop them.
Our last working Radiant Turret on this side of Stormfall is in Sandorâs barricade, north from here. Get to him and tell him that reinforcements will come.
But his orders are to hold his ground at any cost until they arriveâ¦ if his line breaks, the farmlands will be lost.
The storm be with you! Donât look back!
Hey Ben, you believe in those rumours? Dead walking and ghastly apparitions?
These guards are as scared as we are! We wonât see the sunrise tomorrow!
Oi, come back here! Youâre going to get yourself killed!
Please donât tell me you are the reinforcements.
Maybe. I have a message for Sandor.
What? Wait I didnât authori â
You want reinforcements? Iâm all youâre going to get. Now letâs go!
To the North! Push them back into the ground!
Squad 1, take the South! Squad 2, to the West! Show them the might of the storm, weâll live through this!
Stand your ground! Donât let them get to the cannon!
Come on, you big fat green!
Who the hell are you, soldier?
Some messenger you are! Whatâs the message then?
That the reinforcements are coming âsoonâ.
Impeccable timing. Take their sweet time as we get hammered. We wonât hold for much longer if they donât get here soon.
Thereâs more. Your orders are to stand your ground at any cost until they arrive.
My menâs morale is hanging by a thread! Their friends are dead, they are famished, wounded. We have one cannon that barely works and little to no arrows left, what am I to do?
These buffoons are sentencing us to death for no reason. We wonât withstand the next bloody assault!
Oh yes, and why is that?
Iâm taking the fight to them.
Come back here, you fool! They have a giant burning one leading them, it will fry you alive!
Iâm not letting your men die, Sandor.
âA giant burning one.â That explains a lot. I must find this beast and stop it.
Not againâ¦ Itâs getting closer to the city. What the hell is going on?
The entrance to their network. Sneaky bastards.
So many eggsâ¦ These are not random raids, theyâre here to colonize.
The phenomenon! That must be why the Svriir are flocking to the surface!
There is nothing random about this. Its frequency is accelerating.
So thatâs where the âgiant oneâ is hiding. His challengers got fried aliveâ¦
Whoâs the alpha now? Damn, I wish Val had heard that one.
No sir, for the fifth time, you are not on the list!
B-b-but there must be a mistake! Check the âBâs, I must be in the âBâs!
Sir, could you kindly move aside?! We are on the list, unlike you!
I need to see the Merchant-Prince at once! My family demands measures against these earthquakes! Let me through!
Look whoâs here! I must sayâ¦ Iâm impressed, soldier. When Sandor told me you single-handedly saved the farmlands, I couldnât quite believe itâ¦ But here you stand, victorious!
Glad I could help. I will be on my way now.
What? Nonsense! Everyone is talking about the hero who stopped the Svriir! Including the Merchant-Prince himself! He actually wants to reward you in person!
Iâm not sure itâs a good idea. I would rather keep away from honoursâ¦
Declining our rulerâs invitation is not an option! Go to the Palace, the guards will let you in.
So much for keeping a low-profile.
An onyx! Symbol of the city of Gomora! Jewel ofâ¦ Jewel ofâ¦ the earth?
No, you imbecile! Letâs start again!
Stormfall, of course! Our good city! The Jewel of the Sea!
We excel at diamond crafting, cartography and anything related to the sea! Our navy is unparalleled!
Noble traits indeed. But these days I wish we would excel at obliterating Svriirâ¦
Youâd better remember this time: the onyx is for Gomora, Jewel of the Pariahs.
The only known place around the four realms that shelters all types of dark cults, as long as they behave.
Many worrying myths and tales shroud the isolated cityâ¦ forbidden magic, cursed items, rumours of psychic abductionsâ¦
Why we are allied with them is beyond me. A city of filth for the filthy. We should be above that.
An Emerald for the Jewel of the mountains. Three-Peaks is the city of the thousand bridges.
It merges three mountaintops into a single city. They specialize in spices, incense and spiritual insights.
Ahem. A story for another time.
The best swords of the four realms come from here; VulcaÃ¯n, The Jewel of steel.
Their ruby is as red as the volcanoâs pit under the city. The weapons they forge are legendary both in quality and price.
Yes, of course! An alexandrite, symbol of Salander, Jewel of the Earth.
The city is built underground among the ruins of an old civilization. They specialize in the trade of ancient artefacts and their history.
Archion! The flying city! A sapphire represents the Jewel of the Clouds!
This city has three anchor points throughout the year. It changes positions, selling knowledge in exchange for slaves.
Iâve heard they get that knowledge from rangers they send beyond the frontiers of the known world.
Their casualties confirm what we already know: the two other continents arenât meant for humans. A Shame.
Oh! I love that one! An Amber for Câtul, the Jewel of the Hunt.
The city is actually built across the back of two gigantic beasts walking side by side. It is perpetually in movement across vast plains circled by lush jungles!
Calm down. What do we trade with them?
Exotic creatures and quality leather! This is more important than the diet of these beasts that amaze your young mind.
Come forward! Meet Merchant-Prince Damaskus of Stormfall, keeper of the sea jewel, the city and all its people.
On behalf of the people of Stormfall, I thank you and hereby name you the champion of the city.

{Milord, Iâm glad I could help but I would really, really like to avoid the champion thing and go back to my daily routine.|Milord, Iâm glad I could help but I would really, really like to avoid the champion thing and go back to my daily routine.}
Your humility honours you, champion, but smile and rejoice with us. Your bravery saved many lives. You made this a day of victory!
Look, they arenât even saved! The Svriir were not attacking, they were fleeing the phenomenon from the deep â
You saw the apparitions, didnât you?
Thereâs more and more of them. You have to warn your people!
{You canât keep your men in the dark! They arenât prepared for this!|You canât let your men in the dark! They arenât prepared for this!}
I am doing whatâs best for the city! Mass panic wonât do anyone any good!
I have allies studying this phenomenon. They will bring me answers, then we shall act with what little forces we have left. Until then, keep this to yourself if you really want to help the city.
No more delays. I should meet with Val now.
Damaskus is playing a dangerous game.
Stay in line if you want food!
For the ninth time, no Harlan, you canât use the lift. Orders are strict.
And how, pray tell, am I supposed to honour my shipment!?
Not my problem. Given the current situation we have bigger things on our hands.
Iâm telling you, Merchant-Prince Damaskus is done for! The noble houses will never forgive this mess!
Now, now, careful with the bad mouthing. Itâs bad for business.
Look at them, they are getting angrier!
Maâam, we really should leave, things are getting out of control.
Oh, shut your mouth! Both of you! I want to see the action!
Donât you understand? Thereâs nowhere to go! So we might as well enjoy the show from the front row!
Arenât you ashamed?! Firing on your own people, shame on you! Shame on you all!
This must be it. Letâs hope sheâs in there.
Deepest apologies, all our rooms are full. You should search elsewhere for accommodation. Promptly.
Yes, yes, thatâs not what Iâm here for. Look, did you see a tall blonde woman around? A tad crazy? Does that ring any bells?
I havenât seen such a woman {sir|maâam}â¦ So maybe you should really look for her outside.
Youâre acting weird. You okay? Hello?
Iâm sorry! They were here before you arrived, I didnât know what to do!
An Alastor? Tell me, friend, why is an elite Republican assassin coming for me? Weâre on the same team here.
Thereâs no need to panic, friend. Iâm just here to escort you back to camp.
Youâ¦ you two arenât going to fight, are you?
Oh, youâll see her. But for now, you drop your weapons and come with me.
Youâre smarter than you look. Donât make this harder than it has to be. If you do not come quietly, you will be branded as a deserter, then Iâll have the authority to âhandleâ you.
Handle me? You do not just âhandleâ one of the children of Heimlock. Start dancing, dead man.
He is a witchcraft user, donât let him use his powers!
This is not good. Not good at all. Why send an Alastor for me? Something must have happened to Val, she canât be behind this.
I must get through the Purifiers and meet with Heimlock. Only he can set things straight.
To the coast. Iâm coming Val.
The Purifiers went through Wildlings territory to attack the Brotherhood of Dawn. This is where Iâll find them.
Thereâs more and more of them. This is getting out of hand! Damaskus will regret not addressing this while he had the time.
This demon we crossed is crushing these lands.
I doubt the demon alone is behind thisâ¦ as powerful as they are, this amount of power is unprecedented.
Heâs not alone, we found out that a whole cult is with him. The cult of the Sleeper they call themselves. We donât know what they want, though. That demonâ¦ did you get his name?
I wishâ¦ I just got his rage.
If only we would have taken him togetherâ¦
So I take it we won the battle against the Brotherhood of Dawn?
We did. Their camp is burning as we speak.
Not well enough. Taking the flank left them no chance to rally and push us back.
Nearby. We are packing up and ready to leave. Stormfall wouldnât be too happy if they found a Republican army near their borders.
Oh trust me, Stormfall has much worse to worry about with tormented souls roaming the countryside!
You mean the slaughter of Highpeak.
Aye, we were down to the three of us with Val. Outnumbered ten to one with no escape routeâ¦ The final stand of the âChildren of Heimlockâ.
It was a close one, yes. Why the nostalgia, though?
That night the three of us swore to always keep each otherâs back. No matter the odds.
Yeah. I meant every word of it, and still do. I donât care what kind of curse has fallen upon you, I wonât let MaÃ«lys get in your way, {Brother|Sister}.
The only judgement I acknowledge will be the one of Heimlock.
The remains of the Brotherhood of Dawnâs camp is north of us.
Come to me little pups! I will carve your flesh and wipe my arse with your Republican skin!
I know that smell. Weâre burning the bodies?
No choice. Youâve seen the necromancy as much as we did. Weâre not letting this cult have a pile of bodies to fuel its ranks.
We should fight that cult while weâre here. Stormfall is filled with future cadavers.
You know as well as I do that Stormfall refused a Republican protectorate more times than I can think of. If they want to fight alone, let them die alone.
Theyâre not simpletons, their sovereignty would die with Republican troops keeping their lands for them.
Everything has a cost. Now is the time for them to earn their sovereignty, or die trying. The Purifiers are going home. We are going home, {Brother|Sister}.
Waitâ¦ I wonât beg for mercy, I made my peace. But before you finish this, you have to knowâ¦
Know what? What were you doing here?
We tracked an unholy procession from the Cult of the Sleeper all the way to the Coast of Wrecksâ¦ But a powerful magic shrouded their final destination.

Soon after, when the Svriir crisis began, we made an agreement with Merchant-Prince Damaskus that we would handle the Cult of the Sleeper while he protects the population from the Svriir. We made camp and studied the signs.
Yes, theyâre gaining strength, whatever is causing them.
Those cultists, what do they want? Did you learn anything?

We were preparing an expedition to find out. Below Stormfall, our scouts had just found a necropolis that runs deep beneath the earth, something is hidden there. But the Republican assault ruined our chances to help the cityâ¦ Stormfall is doomed.
{Your judgement awaits, Brother.|Your judgement awaits, Sister.} No more delays, letâs go.
We made camp on the other side of this grove.
What if Heimlock doesnât understand? What if he listens to MaÃ«lys?
His judgement is final. Thereâs no point arguing whether or not he will make the right choice.
He saved our lives and gave us purpose. If he believes that you betrayed that purpose, itâs his prerogative to end you.
Just like that. You wouldnât bat an eye?
Oh trust me, I would be devastated. But I would accept it nonetheless. And so should you.
Easy for you to say, itâs not your neck on the line.
Donât speak like that. There are worse fates than death. And dishonouring the judgement of the man that made you who you are is one of them.
His ruling will clarify everything. We just have to go through MaÃ«lys.
Letâs assume I believe you. What did you expect by coming back here?
Only whatâs right for Valeria and I.
I cannot afford the political cost of sheltering you. But, I can give you another chance at survival, another chance to serve mankind far from these lands.
You will leave for Stormfall at once, and live as an exile by taking the first boat to the city of Gomora. Among the pariahs of the world, you might not be noticed.
Even if I doâ¦ what of Edric? What will you do with Valeria? She was just evading MaÃ«lysâ frenzy, she is still loyal to you and the Republic!
No. Your path isnât theirs. Not any more. Even my influence couldnât save Valeria. Her fate is sealed, accept it as I must.
She deserves more than being chased and put down like a dog! I hoped you would not have been so cold for once but you never cared, did you?
Iâm risking much more than my political survival by not killing you on the spot! Do not dare to presume to know of my feelings. Letâs make this very clear: you will do as I command.

You shall not delve into matters you do not understand nor shall you look for Valeriaâ¦ for if you do, you will forfeit this chance Iâm giving you. Now go, this track will lead you back to Stormfall. Farewell, my childâ¦
There is no giving up on family. No matter the odds, right Val?
Damaskus, you will help me find her.
Milord, I know of your deal with the Brotherhood of Dawn. But Iâm sure by now youâve heard that they have been crushed by Republican Purifiers.
I have the report, yes. The hour is bleak, champion. So, what brings you to the Palace?
Iâm looking for someone fleeing with the remaining Brothers. I ask of you for your scoutsâ help.

I have ways to locate their position and track them. But I donât really see why I should spare precious resources on your behalf at this darkest hour. I need every man I can muster against the Svriir and even more now that the Cult of the Sleeper has revealed itself.
Nothing comes for free, Milord, so letâs strike a deal. The Brotherhood was preparing an expedition into a necropolis below Stormfall.

They believed it would lead them to the Cult of the Sleeperâs destination, key to understanding the phenomenon and stop it. I will finish their job in exchange for your assistance to locate my friend.

Such audacity. I would tell you and your bloated ego to jump off the city walls. But if anyone can indeed sport such a behaviour, it is you, champion. Very well, I accept. Reach the Smugglerâs Path through the sewers on the way to the lower rings of the city.
I pray that you find the answers we need before this crisis engulfs my city for good.
Disperse and go back to the lower rings at once! Weâll make use of force again if needed!
Scum invading our good city. Makes me sick.
Eh! And if thatâs not enough, that smell of burnt flesh is quite the deterrent.
Good! Let that smell fill the city I say!
Should make âem reminder what happens when you mess with the city watch!
Everywhere! Theyâre everywhere! Oh they come for us, they come for us all!
The Smugglerâs Path must be over here.
Svriir are overflowingâ¦ I wouldnât go in there if I were you.
These undead did not come from the phenomenonâ¦ the Cult of the Sleeper canât be far.
A chilling breeze coming from the depthsâ¦\n\n Soul magic.
The Necropolis. No turning back now.
This is the tail end of the unholy procession that went through here. The Cult of the Sleeper has much to answer for.
Sulphurous smell, soul spawnâ¦ Thereâs a fully fledged demon down there.
A demon, just for meâ¦ I should never have come here. Aloneâ¦ What was I thinking?!
I absorbed some of its energy, I might as well put it to good use while it lasts!
Youâve been further than any of them. They would understand if you fled.
Is she dead? Did she abandon you?
Why are you here? What are you trying to achieve?
You are too weak to succeed. A pointless death will accomplish nothing.
The protective dome is ruptured, and the dark whispers have stopped.
No way across this chasmâ¦ Unless I free those bones. That might do it.
The air is freezing. I must be getting closeâ¦ But to what?
Good. The summoning canât be stopped now. The devourer shall feast on their soul. Come now, let us greet the interloper.
The Sleeper is merciful. You will serve, even in death.
More of them? So this is where they come fromâ¦
As old as the world itselfâ¦
Those lights must represent the function of this place. Is this gigantic structure funnelling energy? To where? And for whom?
I too work in the service of preserving the Creation. Isnât that the purpose of your kind, guardians?
Lies. You serve only the madness of your Abbathu Lord.
Why lie when truth is even sharper? Either way, you were created to serve, and serve you will!
We do not bow to the Fallen Primordials!
We cannot prevail here, Mizzeonth! We must bide our time, survive until we have aid.
It gave Mizzeonth her chance. I die with pride.
Die? You are not to die. You are to fulfil your function, in service of the Sleeper.
I hear his whispers, his truth! The Sleeper is within me!
I must save the last one if I want answers!
Even if weâve failed to stop you, one of the remaining Primordials will come.
And who will it be, mmh? The one drifting through the void? The insane one? Or maybe the one too busy to care? Did I forget any?
Hear the sad truth Mizzeonth: none of them are coming. You are alone.
Your every word is poison. Finish this.
With pleasure. But first, I must have a little chat with my future host. Come closer, vessel.
We did. You and I had an argument on that cliff. Alas, your friend intervened. How is Val?
Leave while you can, mortal. YudaÃ¯âs powers are beyond you and I.
I fled once. This time I will do what I must.
What do you want from me?

If you thought you had any importance in all of this, then Iâm sorry to disappoint. Youâre nothing but an entertaining speck. But since youâre here, I guess you will make a fine host. I do fancy your powers.
Free will is nothing but a burden for you.
Surrender your mind to me and I shall grant you powers beyond measure!
I made it! I banished a demon on my own! Damn, my powers are growing, and I still donât know whatâs causing them.
Such power isnât meant to be contained within a mortal shell. Unlessâ¦ yesâ¦ I feel your potential. Something has unlocked it. But how?

I am Mizzeonth. My kind were created by the Primordials to protect their structures from evil. Without their guidance, we grew weak. I realize now that our failure was inevitable. The cult of the Sleeper tainted Anankis forever.
What do you know about this cult?
They are part of an unholy pact known as the Covenant of the Blind. We believe it to be made of three Abbathu Lords. AnameterassÃ¼ the Sleeper, Ashtaroth the Aberrant and Ashod the Puppeteer.
Theâ¦ the Abbathu, what are they?
Fallen Primordials whose understanding of Creation became absolute and twisted. Demons, as powerful as they are, are mere servants of these all-powerful beings.
That doesnât sound good. What do they want? What did they do to Anankis?
I must get to the core and stop this now!
Banishing YudaÃ¯ didnât stop the haunting of this place.
Finally, the core should be near.
I do not have to kill you, do not force my hand!
I wonât hold back, Brother! Please, for the last time, I beg you to stop this madness!
You stand accused of desertion, murder of your own people, consorting with the occult and conspiring with enemies of the Republicâ¦
Betraying your own father was the last straw.
I told you his judgement was final!
You chose to betray him, you forced me into this position!
After Iâm done with you, I will rip out Valeriaâs spine!
Father is all I have left!
Come to me, we do not have much time before my essence vanishes from this world. Neither of us have time to grieve our losses. You have to hear me before I inexorably fade into oblivion.
Not without pain. Whatâs the situation?
The earthquakes are intensifying, and with them, I have reports of dead sightings and ghastly apparitions coming from everywhereâ¦ Champion, tell me you learned how to stop this madness.
Tell me, have you ever heard of the worshippers of the Searing Song?

If memory serves, the Republic rose from the remains of the kingdom of Alia after the civil war. Back then, the keepers of the faith and kingâs guards were followers of the Searing Song, nowadays better known as The Brotherhood of Dawn.
Them again? Careful with your history lessons, books are full of liesâ¦
And so is your head. What do they have to do with this anyway?
{Supposedly they can help us stop the phenomenon.|They supposedly can help us stop the phenomenon.}
Did your trackers locate the group of Brothers that were with my friend?
A deal is a deal. Sheâs still alive. Once I have your full report, I will share her location.
Milord, the entire population is flocking to the palace. I donât know if we have enough men to contain them this time.
The fog has stopped, the population IS safe.
Indeed, we do not need the last bastion of order to fall to this madness. If Stormfall is to recover, something has to stand strong.
When a body is infected, it is sometimes better to sever the dying limb and move on, alive.
This is folly. We canât let the people fend for themselves. How are they to believe in us if we do nothing?
Milord, just say the word and my guards will let them through.
I wonât stand idly by watching my people suffer. Thunderblade!
Choose your next words carefully Milord. Should that chaos spread to the final ring, House Blacktide will withdraw support from your claim to the throne.
